dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, the Barden Treblemakers, an all-male a cappella group dressed in matching smoking jackets, conclude singi Universal's theme song.

dialogues.speaker: BRRMP BRRMP
dialogues.text: The audience cheers. Then, the Trebles begin Rihanna's, “Don’t Stop The Music,” and the place goes apeshit. BARDEN TREBLEMAKERS (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE DON'T STOP THE MUSIC, MUSIC,
dialogues.text: MUSIC/PLEASE DON’T STOP THE MUSIC, MUSIC... (song continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREDITS ROLL as a gorgeous girl, CHLOE (20), dressed like 1970's flight attendant, frantically rummages through a swanky dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Shitballs, where is it? Chloe stops, reaches into her jacket pocket, and pulls ou red scarf. Relieved, she DASHES out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the BU Treblemakers sing, we WIDEN TO REVEAL: A sold o audience at Lincoln Center. The atmosphere is reminiscent an American Idol finale. PROUD PARENTS, COEDS, and A CAPPELLA FANATICS hold up signs: “I HEART BELLAS”, “I'LL TREBLE 4 YA!”, and “A CAPPELLA IS MY CO-PILOT!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A winded Chloe runs up a set of stairs, clumsily wrapping scarf around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAIL and JOHN, a cappella alums, color-commentate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This is exactly the type of performance you would expect to see at “The International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella.” Isn’t that right, Gail?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: John, you're so right that everything else seems wrong. This is what the ICCA’s are all about. The Barden Treblemakers. The guys are crushing

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: The Barden University Treblemakers never disappoint. It is their showbotage that is re-defining modern a cappella. And the ladies, well, they just can’t get enough.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: Yes. Nothing makes a girl feel more like a woman than a man who sings like a boy. A TREBLE steps forward to solo the next lyric.

dialogues.speaker: I WANNA TAKE YOU AWAY.
dialogues.text: On the word, “Away”, he goes flat.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL/JOHN
dialogues.text: Whoa! /Boom!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: That was flatter than my ex-wife’s chest. The Asian one. [get alts]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe runs past a variety of A CAPPELLA GROUPS readying themselves to compete, stopping at the all-female Bellas: group of model-esque ladies dressed exactly like her. Chl lifts up her scarf and comes face to face with Alice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I found it! On stage the BU Treblemakers continue singing.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Chloe, look at you. You’re a mess. ALICE, the aggressive leader, undoes Chloe's scarf and th methodically re-ties it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re unreliable. You’re unfocused. And your breath smells like egg. Like, all the time. Alice pushes the knot up to Chloe's throat. Chloe winces. Then, Alice turns to address both Chloe and AUBREY, an exceptionally focused girl standing next to her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t believe the Bellas are in the hands of you two slut bags after we graduate. Alice gets right up in Aubrey’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eff up your solo, and I’‘1l tell everyone you were born without a butthole and it all just comes out the front.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I won’t disappoint you. My dad always says if you’re not here to win, get the hell out of Kuwait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trebles end their performance to wild applause.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: With a couple of shaky notes in there, it’s anybody’s game now. Next up, BU’s other group, The Barden Bellas. BACKSTAGE: The Trebles brush past the Bellas. BUMPER, the Trebles outspoken ringleader, stops to address them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: (“genuine”) Good luck out there. Seriously. I mean that. You guys are awesome...ly horrible. I hate you. Kill yourselves. (all girly) Girl Power! Sisters before Misters! Go get ‘em gang! Bumper crosses away. An infuriated Alice turns to the lad

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Now or never, bitches! HANDS IN! Alice puts her fist out. Nine others meet hers.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One, two --

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: (Mariah Carey-high note)

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Please give it up for the Barden Bellas! The ladies run out on stage and take their position. Alic steps up to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: The Bellas. Making history as the first all-female group to ever advance to the ICCA finals.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: John, why do you think it’s taken so long for an all-lady group to break through the glass ceiling of a cappella?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, women typically can’t hit the low notes that round out a musical arrangement and that limits them. They’re about as good at a cappella as they are at being doctors. ON STAGE: Alice blows the pitch pipe. It’s red with a lar cursive “B” on it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four... They begin the arrangement and choreography to Ace of Bas ‘The Sign’. The performance is over-polished and safe.

dialogues.speaker: LIFE, YOU WOULD HARDLY RECOGNIZE
dialogues.text: ME, I’M SO GLAD... (song continues)

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: So just how did the Bellas make it to the finals?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hard work, Gail. When it comes to the technical aspects of the performance, they never falter. Plus they are very good looking.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: IT’S ENOUGH, ENOUGH.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW THAT I... “The Sign” rendition has lulled the audience into a coma- state. One JUDGE even yawns.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Feels like we all just took a left turn into Snoozeville, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And parked in a lot where they do not validate.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: At this level of competition they’re a little too traditional, don’t you think? No surprise factor.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s like after nine years of marriage knowing exactly what my Orthodox Jewish wife will be wearing to bed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: The wig, John?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And the wool skirt. John and Gail wince. Aubrey steps up to solo.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PALE MOON WHERE I SEE A
dialogues.text: LOT OF STARS/IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW/I SAW THE SIGN AND IT OPE(NED)... Aubrey projectile PUKES and we FREEZE. The puke hangs the frozen in mid-air. TITLE CARD: PITCH PERFECT. END OPENING CREDITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Kansas’s, “Carry On Wayward Son” as a Prius trave down the highway, passing a sign: “Barden Univ., Next Exi TITLE CARD: FOUR MONTHS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move-In Day. GREETERS in polo shirts direct traffic. A ta pulls up carrying BECA MITCHELL, a pretty freshman with heavy eyeliner. Beca listens to a dub step remix of Sia’s “Titanium” on a pair of DJ-style headphones.

dialogues.speaker: GREETER
dialogues.text: (super chipper) Hi there! Welcome to Barden University. What dorm? Beca takes off her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Baker Hall, I think. The Greeter pulls out a map.

dialogues.speaker: GREETER
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what you're going to do. Take that first right... The Prius pulls into BU. A MOM drives and a DAD sits shotgun. JESSE, a confident underdog with boyish good loo sits in the back and sings “Wayward” out the window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 All 11

dialogues.speaker: CARRY ON MY WAYWARD SON...
dialogues.text: The Prius pulls right along side Beca’s taxi, near the greeters. Beca turns to see Jesse singing in the backseat They lock eyes. You think he'll stop singing. He doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: REMEMBER
dialogues.text: Beca stares in confused wonderment as Jesse continues to sing. After a beat, the Prius pulls away. The Greeter’s voice snaps Beca back to reality.

dialogues.speaker: GREETER
dialogues.text: +. And your official BU rape whistle. Don’t blow it unless it’s actually happening. Nobody likes that. Beca reluctantly takes the whistle as the taxi pulls away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the lawn, FRAT GUYS use numbered paddles to rate the Freshmen girls as they walk by. A GAY COUPLE helps their unload IKEA-like furniture from a mini-van. Beca takes it in, not looking particularly enthused. OMIT All

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beca’s shy, KOREAN ROOMMATE is already there. She sits at the edge of her bed, silent.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You must be Kimmy Jin. I’m Beca. KIMMY JIN just stares back. Awkward. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No English? Yes English? Just tell me where you’re at on English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stands outside the Prius with two large duffel bags His mom won’t release him from a long embrace.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Okay. Can’t breath. Mom lets go. Dad hugs him just as hard.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kimmy Jin hasn’t moved. Beca nervously talks as she unzip her suitcase, pulling out a set of turn-tables and assort deejay equipment.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (re: equipment) Well, this is it. My music is everything to me, Kimmy Jin. So please don’t touch, cool? Like ever, okay? Kimmy Jin just stares. Beca tries to read her for a momen BECA (CONT’D) It is extremely important to me that you acknowledge this interaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse opens the door to find BENJI APPLEBAUM hanging a Ti Fighter mobile over his bed. Benji’s a benevolent nerd wh makes Jesse look studly by comparison.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: There he is. You must be Jesse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And you must be kidding. WIDEN TO REVEAL: A room decorated with huge amounts of sc memorabilia: A life-sized Darth Vader, a twenty-sided die chair, a Battlestar tribute wall, and a big box with swor sticking through it. A beat, as Jesse and Benji take it i

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Looking at it now, I can see that it’s a lot. I’11 take it down --

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No way! Took me a second for my eyes to adjust but I can roll with this.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Just so you know. I’m not a total nerd. I also happen to be super into close-up magic. Benji pulls a hamster out of his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Dude! That’s awesome! Benji nods, “I’m pretty good.” Then:

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long was the little guy in there? INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - CONTINUOUS 15 Beca finishes converting her desk into a musical workstat (Turntables, keyboard, laptop). There’s a KNOCK on the do A MAN speaks in falsetto.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s Missy, your R.A! You guys keep it down in there! Beca opens the door to reveal DR. FRANCIS MITCHELL, (49), sweet-faced man with JFK hair and a corduroy blazer.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. It’s just your ol’ man trying to make a funny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Chris Rock, everybody. Dr. Mitchell enters. Kimmy Jin is still sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (to Kimmy Jin) Hi. Dr. Francis Mitchell, Beca’s dad. I’m a professor here... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: JOB TITLE TBD.
dialogues.text: There’s no response. Dr Mitchell turns back to Beca. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) So when did you get here? How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Took a cab from the airport. Didn't want to inconvenience you and Sheila. How is the stepmonster?

dialogues.speaker: DR MITCHELL
dialogues.text: She’s great. She’s on her way to Vegas. Never been before. Gave her my lucky...

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Don’t really care, dad. Just wanted to say “stepmonster.”

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Well do I at least get a hug? It’s been a while since I've seen you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Mitchell forces a hug on Beca. Beca doesn't hug back.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Well, that’s what happens when you leave your wife and daughter and move 3000 miles away for some hooker. +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (to Kimmy) Sheila’s a pharmaceutical sales rep. That's very different than a hooker. So, you been on the quad yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the springtime, students study on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to study on the grass. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t need college. What I need is to live in LA, work at a music label, start paying my dues --

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Oh boy. Here we go again. Beca, DJ’‘ing is not a profession. It’s a hobby. Unless you’re Rick Dees or someone awesome like that --

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t want to just deejay. I want to produce music. Make music --

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: You're getting a college education. For free, I might add. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Great. So instead of getting real world experience in what I actually want to do with my life, I'll spend four years studying on the grass. There’s an awkward beat of silence.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMY JIN
dialogues.text: I’m going to the Activities Fair. She speaks. Beca is surprised but seizes the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Well then so am I. I’m going to go with my super-good friend, Kimmy Jin. Beca grabs her bag and they exit, leaving Dr. Mitchell.  16 17 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of recruiting booths are set up throughout the q Anything and everything is represented: One booth reads, Word: A Collection of Feminist Voices,” another says, “Ba Newspaper,” another reads “Dudes With Ponytails. Est. 198 Beca, headphones around her neck, and Kimmy Jin are at th booth: “RIAC: Running in a Circle.” Two REPRESENTATIVES g Beca the hard sell.

dialogues.speaker: RIAC REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: Basically what we do is we join arms in a large ring and we run clockwise and sometimes we’ll do variations on that.

dialogues.speaker: RIAC REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: It’s really about movement and, health, circulation, mimicking the earth’s orbit around the sun.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: So you run around in a circle?

dialogues.speaker: RIAC REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: And so can you. He holds out a pen for Beca to sign up.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m gonna look around --

dialogues.speaker: RIAC REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: -- Around!

dialogues.speaker: RIAC REPRESENTATIVE
dialogues.text: You would do so well here. Kimmy Jin spots the “Korean Students Association” booth a makes a beeline for it. The KOREAN STUDENTS welcome her w open arms. Beca, now alone, puts her headphones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE FAIR: Jesse and Benji stride through, stopping the gratuitously rowdy Sigma Beta Theta FRAT booth. Good- looking, bare-chested, beefy GUYS party and chant.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT GUYS
dialogues.text: “Drinking beer, smoking dope, sucking on a tit! (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRAT GUYS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you ain’t pledging SBT, then you ain’t worth no shit!”

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: That’s a double negative.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of negatives.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Follow me. There’s only one group on this campus worth joining. NEEDLE DROP: A HEAVY GUITAR LICK kicks in as the camera F over the fair, table after table, finally landing on... THE Barden Treblemakers: A motley crew of eight confident nerds sitting under a tree: DONALD, a cool dude with blac glasses, UNICYCLE, a guy always astride a unicycle, a few other thin, unathletic DWEEBS, and BUMPER, the outspoken ringleader. Jesse and Benji stand nearby. Benji gestures to the guys.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As far as Barden goes, that’s what being a man is all about. Bumper blows an iPhone pitch pipe. The Trebles suddenly r and sing the gayest version of The Dazz Band’s “Let It Wh Amazingly, a HANDFUL OF PRETTY GIRLS gather around to lis

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Treblemakers. The rock stars of a cappella, the messiahs of Barden. Well, you know, not including athletes, frat guys, or actual cool people.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Organized nerd singing! Is this for real?

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: You bet it is. How’s your voice? Jesse joins the Trebles in “Let It Whip.” Benji’s impress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aubrey and Chloe stand in front of their tiny “Bellas” bo handing out flyers. Aubrey scoffs at the Trebles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I will stop at nothing to take down those dicklicks. [ALT: suck butts] A homely girl, BARB, walks up.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hey, Barb! Gonna audition this year? We have openings. Chloe tries to hand her a flier but Barb won’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: BARB
dialogues.text: Oh, now that you’ve puked your way to the bottom, you might actually consider me? I’ve auditioned three times and never got in because you said my boobs look like baloney. Barb puts her hands on her hips. Her cardigan is pulled b revealing two huge, baloney-like areolas beneath her t-sh

dialogues.speaker: BARB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The word’s out. The Bellas’s are the laughing stock of a cappella. Good look recruiting this year, douche-b’s. Barb leaves. Chloe looks a tad shaken.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: This. Is. (singing)

dialogues.speaker: A TRAVESTY
dialogues.text: (then) If we can’t recruit Baloney Barb, we can’t get anybody.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Take the dramatics down a notch.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You're the one who got us into this hot mess!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: We'll be fine. I’m confident we’ll find eight super-hot girls with bikini ready bodies who can harmonize and have perfect pitch. A PACK OF HOT GIRLS walk by. Aubrey offers a flyer. They PUSH her away and keep walking. Aubrey dons her “game fac (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep flyering. We have a tradition to uphold.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: How about we just get good singers. A chubby GIRL walks up and takes a flier from Chloe. CHLOE (CONT’D) CHUBBY GIRL Hi! Can you sing? Yep. Can you read music? Yep. Can you match pitch? Chloe sings three notes. The girl matches them, perfectly

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY GIRL
dialogues.text: You want me to do it in “A’?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Your name?

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY GIRL
dialogues.text: Fat Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You call yourself Fat Amy?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Yep. So you twig bitches don’t do it behind my back.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: See you at auditions... Fat Amy. Fat Amy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was oddly satisfying. ANGLE ON: Beca, who has now stopped at a booth called “CA DJ'S". She excitedly picks up a flier. It reads: “BARDEN DJ's ("Deaf Jews. A Club For The Hearing Impaired Childre of Israel.”) Beca reacts, bummed. Fat Amy walks up as a JEWISH STUDENT signs and mumbles excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: JEWISH STUDENT
dialogues.text: Shalom! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (loudly, to Student) That’s not a real word! Keep trying! You’ll get it!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (laughs, to Fat Amy) Not a lot of Jewish people where you're from, huh? Beca continues on, passing near the Bella booth. Chloe se Beca and points her out to Aubrey.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hey, what about her? She could be made cute.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Are you blind, Chloe? That girl’s a freak. She’s so not a Bella. Ignoring her, Chloe hands Beca a flyer. Beca takes off he headphones. Beca eyes

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hi! Any interest in auditioning for our a capella group? the flier, then Chloe and Aubrey.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: A capella. Oh right, this is a thing now.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Totes. We sing covers of songs but do it without any instruments. (over sell) It all comes from our mouths! Beca reacts, “Wow.”

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are four groups on campus. the Bellas. That’s us. We’re the tits. The BU Harmonics... THE BU HARMONICS BOOTH: A CO-ED GROUP where HOMELY GIRLS, including Barb, give back rubs to GUYS who don’t k they’re gay yet.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The High Notes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: THE HIGH NOTES: A GROUP that’s always high. A couple of them laugh too hard. Three or four fall over.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Their, um, not particularly motivated. And then there’s -- ANGLE ON: The Treblemaker’s big finish.

dialogues.speaker: BU TREBLEMAKERS
dialogues.text: LET IT WHIP! (LET’S WHIP IT BABY) Beca watches as The Trebles bow to applause. In the distance, she spots Jesse and recognizes him as the “Sing guy in the Prius.” Just then, a stray football hits Uni i the head, knocking him to the ground. BACK TO the ladies. Beca grabs the flier, revealing a tattoo: A preying manth Chloe sees this.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Hey! I have a tattoo!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I sorta went through a punk phase. I was listening to a lot of “Evanescence.” Beca reacts,”0O...kay.”

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hopeful) So are you interested?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Seems pretty lame. Hearing this, Aubrey steps up to Beca.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Aca-scuse me? Synchronized lady dancing to a “Mariah Carey”-chart topper is not lame.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: We sing all over the world and compete in national championships.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: On purpose? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: We played the Cobb Energy Performing Arts Center you bitch! Beca reacts, “Settle.” Chloe plays peacekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What Aubrey means to say is that we're a close-knit, talented group of ladies whose dream is to return to the national finals at Lincoln Center this year. (offering sign up sheet) Help us turn our dreams into a reality?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (to Chloe) Sorry, I'm not really a singer so... It was nice meeting you. Beca walks away. Aubrey starts to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?! The Bellas are finished! Our lives are ov[er]-- (recoils and covers mouth) Uhp. Wait, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Did you almost vomit again?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s the stress.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You need some water?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: No. It didn’t come up that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benji and Jesse walk towards The Trebles.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: I’m going to introduce myself. (covering nervousness) Everybody be cool. It’s just a normal day... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Benji approaches Bumper and the gang.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. Benjamin Applebaum. He firmly shakes Bumper’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I saw you guys perform at the “Mall of America” like three years ago. Changed my life. Haven’t stopped thinking about you since.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL GUY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Hey, vagina! Throw the ball back! Uni throws the ball back like a little girl, loses his balance, and once again falls to the ground, hard.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Bumper, huge fan. Your arrangement of Lovin’ Spoonful’s “Do You Believe in Magic” inspired me to become a certified illusionist. Benji stuffs a red scarf into his fist, and then holds up empty hands. A little piece of the scarf protrudes from Benji’s enormous fake thumb. He fails the trick a couple times. Bumper just stares.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: (to the gang) I feel like I’m too important for this. [ALT: The smell of your “weird” is affecting my vocal chords.” ]

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: So why don’t we exchange emails or maybe totally hang out right now?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Too far. Jesse grabs Benji and hurries him away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BACK ON: Beca at the CAMPUS INTERN booth. She grabs an application for the “Campus Radio Station,” puts on her headphones and we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beca crosses a street and enters the campus radio station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot MASHUP-STYLE REMIX pumps as we’re tight on Beca, he eyes transfixed. BECA’S POV: Inside the deejay booth is LUKE, the smoking-hot, tattooed Station Manager. Beca’s smitten. The guy, the music... Everything. After a beat, Luke turns, catching Beca staring. He smile lowers the volume, and opens the deejay booth door.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey. You been there long?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (flustered) Um, no, I was, uh... I just got here. Like now. I wasn’t standing here for a while or anything... She awkwardly approaches the booth. Luke stands, official

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sorry, but freshman aren’t allowed in the booth. He steps out and extends his hand. She shakes it like a nerd. LUKE (CONT’D) Luke. Station Manager. You must be Beca. Jesse enters, in a rush.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And I’m Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m Luke. And you're late. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse turns to Beca. A look of realization crosses his fa

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. (to Luke, pointed) He doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Okay. You two can figure it out while you’re stacking CD's. Luke points to several crates of CD’s.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you’re done, there’s more. You're gonna be spending a lot of time together, so please... No sex on the desk. I’ve been burned before. Luke exits back into the booth. Beca watches him, then exhales heavily.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I do know you. I sang to you. I remember because you were in a taxi. Wait, is your dad a taxi driver? Ignoring him, Beca starts stacking CD’s. He follows suit. Beca steals a glance at Luke. Jesse clocks this.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... Luke’s attractive. Excellent bone-structure. Full head of hair. Fancy undershirt. I think we just met my nemesis. Beca, frustrated, plops down behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Man, this sucks. I came here to play music, not stack it.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Not me. I’m here for one reason only. I love stackin’ cd’s. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was offered a job at a lab that tests the effects of marijuana on your appetite but I said no. I want to stack cd’s, hopefully in the vicinity of a semen smeared desk -- That’s what we think happened here, right?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (playing along) Too bad I didn’t bring my black light. Then we'd know for sure.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: So what’s your deal? You one of those girls who’s all dark and mysterious until she takes off her glasses and that amazingly scary ear spike and you realize she was beautiful the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t wear glasses.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Then you’re halfway there. (re: stacking) I am loving this.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You're a weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yes I am. And so are you. It’s a good thing we’re going to be best friends and/or lovers.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Please don’t say “lovers.”

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You know, I wouldn’t pass this up. Once I’m a Treble, I probably won’t have time for you.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You know, I didn’t think you could find a way to be less attractive to me, but congrats, you just did. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ha! You're terrific. Just wait. You'll go all squidy and drape yourself all over me. It’1l be fun. You'll see. Beca reacts, “Who is this guy?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beca sits alone, eating. She scans the quad, noticing the SBT guys happily playing ultimate frisbee. Next to them, group of SCIENCE NERDS enjoy studying. Then, the “Running a Circle” group literally runs in a circle and loves it. [SLOW MOTION] Feeling the pangs of loneliness, Beca puts headphones on, lies down, and finds solace in Sia.

dialogues.speaker: SIA, (IN HEADPHONES)
dialogues.text: I’M BULLETPROOF/NOTHING TO LOSE/FIRE AWAY, FIRE AWAY... FADE TO BLACK. Over black, we hear -

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Beca? Beca? Wake up, Beca...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - THE NEXT DAY 29 Beca is in bed, asleep. ANGLE ON: A hand, unplugging the headphones plugged into her computer. Once unplugged, the music plays loudly (TITANIUM). Beca JOLTS awake. REVEAL: Dr. Mitchell, trying to turn the music off. He can’t. Bec unamused, gets out of bed and does it for him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: This doesn’t look like your “Intro to Philosophy” class.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I’m posing an important philosophical question: If I don’t actually go to class, will that class still suck? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beca sits down, and fiddles with some equipment. *

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Okay, I know you’re mad at me. I get it. But I can’t just let you waste your life in this room while you fiddle around with technical equipment I know nothing about. For God sake, you look like a roadie from (mispronouncing) Def Lep-paard!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand why you won’t support me?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: The music industry is a seedy place, Bec. I mean, have you seen * those VH1 Behind the Musics?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Man, ever since you got cable --

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: College is the transition period that prepares you for all the scary things life is gonna throw at you. * You create memories here. I see it everyday. Beca, you've been * here a month. Do you even have any * friends? *

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Kimmy Jin is my friend. REVEAL: Kimmy Jin, quietly studying in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMY JIN
dialogues.text: Nope. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Just try something. Put yourself out there.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I just got a job at the radio station

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: I’ve seen that place. It’s dark and dirty and has what? Three weirdos working there?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Well, four, now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Beca, this is the time in your life to try new things, explore. Not be so fixated on this DJ thing. He points to the audition flier on her desk. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) Like that. Do that. Or run ina circle. Wait, don’t do that. Those kids aren't right. Just do something new. And if in a year, you still don’t want to be here. If you still want to try to be some big time music producer, then... (at a loss) You can quit college and I’1l help you move to LA.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (brightens ) Whoa, whoa. Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Yes. Seriously. But I need to really see it, Bec. You got to get out there. Make friends. Join in. This is college! Beca lingers on the audition notice. She grabs a towel an her toiletries basket and heads into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: es + eH +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one stall, we see two pairs of feet. There’s whisperin

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: You said we'd try it.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: I’1ll get electrocuted!

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: How? Beca walks in, holding a shower caddy and singing Sia’s “Titanium.” She looks upbeat in a way we haven’t seen before. The feet freeze. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOSE/FIRE AWAY, FIRE AWAY...
dialogues.text: Beca doesn’t notice them, gets into another stall, and tu the water on. As she waits for the water to warm, the cam pans over Beca’s shoulder. REVEAL: Chloe, listening, all- smiles. Then:

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You can sing! Beca SCREAMS and attempts to cover her bits with her loof

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How high does your belt go?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: My what?!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: The tone of your voice is beautiful. You have to audition for the Bellas! Beca grabs a shampoo bottle and holds it over her chest.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I can’t concentrate on anything you're saying til you cover your junk.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Just consider it. One time we sang back up for Prince. His butt is so tiny, I can hold it with one hand. [get alts] Beca closes the curtain. Chloe opens it again.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Seriously, I am nude.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You were singing “Titanium” right?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (pulled up) You know David Guetta?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: What, have I been living under a rock? That song is my jam. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (coyly) My “diddle” jam.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Yeah it is! That song builds. (then) Sing it for me?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Ew! No! Get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Not for that reason! Look, I’m not leaving here until you sing so...

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Maybe. (defiant) But I can stand here all day. Beca rolls her eyes. Then, reluctantly starts

dialogues.speaker: LOSE/FIRE AWAY, FIRE AWAY....
dialogues.text: Chloe jumps in, harmonizing. They sound awesome.

dialogues.speaker: AWAY, FIRE AWAY/YOU SHOOT ME DOWN
dialogues.text: BUT I WON’T FALL/I AM TITANIUM/YOU SHOOT ME DOWN BUT I WON’T FALL/I AM TITANIUM. 27. 30 singing. Beca finds herself unexpectedly moved. There’s a long beat of them looking at each other, naked.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m pretty confident about... (motions around her body) All this.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You should be. Chloe hands Beca a towel. Then, Tom pops into frame. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You have a lovely voice.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Thanks? An awkward moment. Chloe pulls Tom out. Beca stands there stunned. PUSH IN ON Beca, smiling, a look of realization crosses her face. We move TIGHTER on Beca, and PRE-LAP...

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Listen up, everybody. For your audition, each of you will sing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audition day. In the hallway outside the auditorium, a lo line of CO-ED’S warm up their voices. TOMMY MARTIN and hi sidekick JUSTIN, a cappella super-fans address the group.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: +. Sixteen bars of Kelly Clarkson's “Since U Been Gone.” If a group likes you, they’1ll contact you directly. My tone deaf sidekick Justin will collect your info.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: If I could carry a tune in any possible human way, I would. But I can’t. I resent myself dearly.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: I've been picked on, wedgied, ridiculed, upper-decked, and cyber- bullied by elected officials. I am also currently failing out of this university. And though I too cannot sing a drop, there is nowhere I'd rather be than in the welcome embrace of Barden a cappella. But if you think this is like some high school club where you sing and dance your way through big social issues you’ve come to the wrong place. It’s nothing like that. That’s high school. This shit is real life.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTIN
dialogues.text: Real life!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (He claps twice) Alright people. Don’t just bring it! Sing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four a cappella groups are there. The Trebles sit in back. Aubrey and Chloe sit in front. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Hey Bellas, remember how you tried to play in the big leagues and choked? Let that be a lesson to everybody. Sing the same girlie shit every year, you’1ll blow chunks all over the place. The rest of the Trebles snicker. Donald does a “too slow” slap to himself. Aubrey braces herself, then stands to address the room.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: My fellow aca-people. As most of you know, it is a make or break year for the Bella ladies. But make no mistake. We will not let egotistical, big-headed, garbage dicks, whoever they may be, get in our way. (then, to Bumper) I promise you. The Bellas will return to the ICCA’s and finish what we started last year. Tommy steps in, getting down to business.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: First up today... He presents CYNTHIA ROSE, a butch looking girl wearing a leather jacket and boots.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (INTO MIC)
dialogues.text: Whenever you’re ready, dude.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Hi, my name’s Cynthia Rose. ANGLE ON: Donald, reacting, “Oops.” CYNTHIA ROSE (CONT’D) (begins singing) BUT SINCE U BEEN GONE... BEGIN “AMERICAN IDOL”-TYPE AUDITION MONTAGE: -- We see QUICK POPS of AUDITIONERS. Some good, some bad. -- A smart-looking plain-faced girl wearing Tina-Fey glas introduces herself as MARY ELISE. She has an adequate voi -- More AUDITIONERS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- Jesse nails his audition. -- More AUDITIONERS. Sprinkled in, we meet four quirky, awkward ladies named JESSICA, ASHLEY, DENISE, and KORI. -- Fat Amy walks on stage and takes the mic. She’s crazy loud, but great.

dialogues.speaker: FOR THE FIRST TIME...
dialogues.text: -- A beautiful girl walks up to the mic. Chloe and Aubrey perk up. She looks like a “Bella.”

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Hi. My name is Stacie. My hobbies are cuticle care and the E! Network. (then, singing) I'M SO MOVING ON, YEAH, YEAH... When Stacie sings, she closes her eyes and makes a strang “Jessica Simpson” weird singing face. It’s disturbing. Fo everybody. -- More pops of PEOPLE, including LILLY, a very shy girl is often inaudible when speaking.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Hello. My name is Lilly Onakuramara. I was born with gills like a fish. The groups react, “What did she say?”

dialogues.speaker: WANT...
dialogues.text: -- Benji auditions. He’s Sinatra-good and a crowd favorit

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: .».. SINCE YOU BEEN GONE! (through applause) Ah, thank you. Performing live gives me such a rush! -- More AUDITIONERS. KOLIO, a cute hispanic guy, sings an sounds exactly like Aaron Neville. It works on him. -- We see QUICK POPS of audition highs and lows until we back on Fat Amy. As she walks off stage, we hear... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I crushed it! [get alts] END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s everybody. Chloe hears the exit door OPEN and sees Beca peeking in.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Wait! There’s one more. Chloe excitedly WAVES her in. Beca walks up on stage.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I didn’t have time to prepare the song.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: It’s okay! Sing anything! Beca sings a kick-ass version of “MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE,” while playing the cups.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: YOU'RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE YOU'RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE OH I KNOW/YOU’RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE... Applause. REVEAL: Jesse, in the wings, loving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of red hoods are pulled off ten girls. Aubrey re off the name of each girl as her hood comes off.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: The Sopranos: Jessica, Mary Elise, Lilly. The Mezzos: Cynthia Rose, Denise, Kori. And our Altos: Fat Amy, Stacie, Ashley, and... Beca. As Beca’s hood is pulled off, she looks totally disorient FROM BECA'S POV: The ladies stand in a room lit by a hazardous amount of candles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On a table rests a chalice of wine and ten red scarves. Aubrey and Chloe stand before them in Bella attire. Aubre blows the pitch pipe.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As your music director and possessor of the pitch pipe, I'd like to welcome you to the Bellas’ initiation night. We shall begin by drinking the blood of the sisters that came before you. Chloe grabs the chalice and presents it to Beca.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Hell no.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: It’s tradition.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Don't worry. It’s Boone’s Farm. Beca takes the chalice, barely taking a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown hoods are removed from the heads of Jesse and Kolio JESSE'S POV: The Trebles sit around in smoking jackets. A hot tub sits in the middle of the room. Bumper approaches

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Well, well. Look who’s in “Treble.”

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Classic pun. Jesse looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Where’s Benji? Donald crosses over and hands Jesse a smoking jacket.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: This is your Treble jacket. We wear these when we perform. On stage. And in bed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: It means you’re one of us. A brother forever.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say. I’11l never lose this.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: You can. We have more. It’s nota big deal.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Uh, it’s kind of a big deal. Pretty big deal. I don’t like it when you undermine me. (then) Okay, time to prove your Treble loyalty by getting stupid-drunk while committing a minor felony. (Timberlake falsetto) LET’S ROCK IT TO THE BREAK OF DONG!

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: (to no one inparticular) He’s like a male Josh Groban.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Now, if you’ll all place your scarf in your right hand. Chloe and Aubrey demonstrate with their scarves.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I, sing your name.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Promise to fulfill the duties and responsibilities of a Bella woman. (repeat) Neither sickness, nor midterms, nor my lady times will prevent me from her-monizing with my sisters. (repeat) And I solemnly promise never to have sexual relations with a Treblemaker or may my vocal chords be ripped out by wolves. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They look around to each other, struggling to repeat it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are all Bellas now. All but Beca erupt in cheers. Chloe turns to Aubrey.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: (looks around, concerned) Did we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trebles stand in front of a van whose license plate r “TNHNGRS.” On the side of the van, there’s a magnetic dec of four guys: professional, elder-statesmen of a cappella Helms-types). Jesse and Kolio spray paint the van a neon blue color while chugging beers.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Every year, the Tone Hangers come back to party on initiation night. And every year we mess with their van.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: When are these losers going to realize nobody should be singing a cappella after college? There’s just some things you should give up before you start to look sad. Uni unicycles into frame.

dialogues.speaker: UNICYCLE
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Hood Night” party. Justin mans the kegs as the aca- groups and their new recruits all file in. The Bellas, le by Aubrey, walk up together. Beca, Fat Amy, and Stacie br up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Ladies, prepare to soften the beach. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ladies, react, “huh.”

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (to Fat Amy) What am I doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Livin’ the dream! I still can’t believe they let my fat ass in.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Me too! For some reason, girls are usually threatened by me. Stacie WHIPS off her top exposing a smokin’ body. Jesse, drunk, stumbles up to Beca.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Beca. Beca... (like a chicken) Be-caw! Be-caw! Are my eyes deceiving me? Jesse wipes his eyes and makes sgeaking noises.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a Bella?! Think of all the memories we’re going to create together!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: And you're drunk! You won’t remember anything tomorrow. Beca does something physical to Jesse. (i.e. Punches him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Oh no she didn’t! Beca shakes her head and laughs. Aubrey clocks this. A tipsy Chloe gives Beca a big hug and puts her face right close.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I’m so glad I met you! I know we're going to be fast friends.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, you’ve seen me naked. Hard not to bond after that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: everybody 36.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: And don’t you worry about Aubrey. She's a good girl. Her parents just never took her out of the shrink wrap. (then, yelling) Okay, Mama's thirsty! [get alts] ANGLE ON: Cynthia Rose and Stacie, talking.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: If I drink too much tonight, will you promise to hold my hair back when I puke?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: (a beat, taking Stacie in) Yes. Yes, I can be trusted to do that. ANGLE ON: Bumper and Donald filling their cups at the keg NEEDLEDROP: Andy Grammer’s “Keep Your Head Up” comes on a SCREAMS! They all sing along.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Who would win in a fight? Captain America or a great white shark.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Great white shark.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Yes huh. All the shark has to do is lure him to international waters. Captain America has no jurisdiction out there. Next question. Who is easiest to sleep with? Captain America or a great white shark...? Fat Amy walks up.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: What are you turds talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: You are the single grossest human I've ever laid eyes on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: You’re no panty-dropper yourself, chief. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: You want to make out? Fat Amy reacts, “Not in a million years” and walks away. Donald laughs. Bumper shoots him a look and elbows him in the ribs. INT. JESSE AND BENJI’S DORM ROOM - SAME TIME 39 Benji, still wide-awake and fully clothed, lays on his be Hearing the music from a distance, he sadly sings.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PARTY, 40
dialogues.text: Bumper, Donald, and Uni sing directly to a group of HOT GIRLS. Kori makes eyes at Donald. Donald breaks off and dances with her. Fat Amy comically dances in the middle o circle of Bella ladies. Outside the circle, Jesse dances wildly. Beca barely moves. Jesse hands Beca a red cup.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Isn’t this awesome?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: It’s definitely something.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (shouts to the heavens) We are the kings of campus! We PULL BACK from Beca to an aerial view of campus: The p is a tiny speck on the campus grid compared to the frat surrounding it. TIME LAPSE: We transition to MORNING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellas are assembled in a classroom/rehearsal space. Amy and Cynthia Rose peruse the framed photos of past Bel groups hanging on a wall. Aubrey writes the words “NEW BELLAS” on a whiteboard. Bec casually strolls into the room. Aubrey, still facing the board, freezes, and then writes Beca’s name on the board a tally mark next to it. Beca rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: As you can see, Kori is not here. Last night, she was Treble-boned. She’s been dis-invited from the Bellas.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: That oath was serious?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Dixie Chicks-serious. You can fool around with anyone you want, just not a Treble.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: That’s not going to be easy (refers to crotch): He’s a hunter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Stacie, the Trebles don’t respect us. They treat us like we’re one big joke. And if we let them penetrate us, we’re giving them our power.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Not a good enough reason to use the word penetrate. Aubrey moves toward Mary Elise.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Anybody have anything to confess? Mary Elise crumbles under the pressure and nods, yes.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn in your scarf and go.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ELISE
dialogues.text: But... it was an accident. It landed in my hand. Aubrey doesn’t waver. Mary Elise stands up to leave, slowly. Every few steps, she looks back, desperately to be stopped. She grabs a chair and drags it across floor. She finally leaves, crying loudly through the

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Was that necessary?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: This is a war, Beca. It’s my job to make sure my soldiers are prepped at go time with three kick ass songs sung and choreographed to perfection. (MORE )
45 very wanting the hall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We only have four months til regionals so if you have a problem with how I run the Bell--ah! (recoils and covers mouth) Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aubrey, relax. We can’t have a repeat of last year.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Umm. What happened last year?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (leans in) What are you asking?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: (a little louder) What happened last year? And do you guys want to see a dead body? A beat, “What did she say?” Then: FLASHBACK: a grainy image of Aubrey as she projectile puk straight into camera while the audience gasps in horror. We PULL BACK to reveal Lilly holding up her ipad while th new Bellas watch in awe. Aubrey’s grief-stricken by the memory. Stacie leans into Lilly.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Ooh, click on “Guy pukes on Cat.”

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Enough! It happened. It’s over. Now, this is how we'll become champions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Aubrey pulls up a screen to reveal a really complicated f chart on another dry erase board. It’s pretty intense.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First things first, we need a vocal percussionist. Does anyone know how to beatbox?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I do! She “Beatboxes.” It’s not great. There’s a lot of spit involved. ANGLE ON: Lilly watching her intently.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: So that would be a “no.” We practice everyday for at least two hours. Seven days a week. We trust you'll add your own cardio.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Why cardio?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Why cardio? I’11 tell you -- (sings) WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY... They wait for her to stop. She doesn’t

dialogues.speaker: YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYVYYYY...
dialogues.text: As she continues, jaws drop and eyes gape. At some point, Fat Amy starts applauding. Others join her.

dialogues.speaker: BECA AUBREY
dialogues.text: Holy shit! YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY

dialogues.speaker: YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY
dialogues.text: Done making her point and as if nothing happened, Aubrey distributes papers.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a list of all the songs we've ever performed. You’ll notice that we only do songs made famous by women. Beca looks disdainfully at the list. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: There’s nothing from this century on here.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Because we don’t stray from tradition. Our focus is perfecting our repertoire. It’s why we’re the best all-female group in the country. Now, let’s start with some vocal warm-ups, practice scales, followed by arpeggios and then work our way up to choreography. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: You said scales and then something about spaghettios? [get alts]

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Arpeggios. God help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Mic technique - All but Fat Amy run the stairs. - Teaching moments to learn how to make instrument sounds with their mouths. - Learn how to dance in heals. -- Dr. Mitchell looks through the rehearsal door’s window He smiles, pleased. - Rehearsal of beatboxing. Failing miserably. - Choreography of each person trying to do a specific ste - Dealing with Stacie’s bad singing face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You're only going to do bump, bump, ba bump... END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m callin’ it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Nothing. I hear nothing.

dialogues.text: Did we just learn the same choreography you did in that video?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) Don't forget to pick up your performance schedules. We have a gig next week. That’s right. Next week.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You guys! It’s Sigma Beta Theta’s Fall Mixer. SBT hires us every year as their entertainment. It pays for our entry fee into regionals.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Hands in, Bellas! Aubrey puts her fist out. The ladies stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hands in, aca-bitches! They all sloppily put their hands in.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY

dialogues.speaker: AHHH

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Beca, a word. Beca spins around.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know you'll have to take that ear monstrosity out for the Fall Mixer.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You really don’t like me, do you?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I don’t like your attitude...

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You don’t even know me.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I know you have a Toner for Jesse. (off Beca’s blank stare) A “Toner.” A musical boner. I saw it. At Hood Night. It’s distracting.

dialogues.text: You're not in charge of me, Aubrey.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You took an oath!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: That oath cost you two girls already. I’m pretty sure you need me more than I need you. Beca heads for the door. Aubrey calls after her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: I can see your toner through those jeans.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE

dialogues.speaker: PERCUSSION... AROUND...
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of party-goers.

dialogues.text: I wanted the hot Bellas, not this nonsense. I’m not paying for this, Aubrey. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY

dialogues.text: I just found out this morning.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: What are nodes?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Vocal Nodules. The rubbing together of your vocal cords at above-average rates without proper lubrication.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: They sit on your windpipe and crush your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Isn't that painful? Why would you keep performing?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Because I love to sing.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: You should really listen to your doctor.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (overly-dramatic) The key is early diagnosis. I’m living with nodes. I’m a survivor. I just have to pull back. Because I’m limited. Because I have nodes.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: And the Oscar goes to... [get alts]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beca sits on the grass, working on her laptop. Jesse walks up, carrying a duffle bag. He takes a seat and makes hims at home. He lays down a bath towel. On it, he puts two juice boxes, an ugly candle, and a can of Pringles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Wow. You must sweep your girlfriend off her feet.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I don’t have a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BECA

dialogues.speaker: JESSE

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What, you don’t like movies? Beca shrugs. Jesse is beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: I watched a porno at a high school party once. The music was okay if you're big into sax solos --

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I mean, they’re fine. But I get bored and never make it to the end.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: The endings are the best part!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Hey, you don’t have to cry. It’s just they’re so predictable. The guy gets the girl, the kid sees dead people, Darth Vader is Luke’s father...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Right. You just happened to guess the biggest reveal in cinematic history.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Vader in German means father. His name is Darth Father. Jesse puts his DVD's back into his duffle.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Huh, you know German. Well, now I see why you don’t like fun things. Beca smiles, pretty pleased with herself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
