dialogues.text: I’m gonna break that jag in half. Beca turns to this rag-tag group of girls.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: What we just did was great, right?.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Calm your pits, Beca. We still lost.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it was spontaneous. There were no rules. And we were... Aubrey puts her hand out, interrupting Beca.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Hands in. “AHHH” on my count.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: On three or after three?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE FAT AMY
dialogues.text: On three. After three.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: No. It’s one, two, “AHHH.”

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: That’s not how we do it.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: What about just “AHHH” with no count off? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Why can’t we figure this out? This debate continues as we TRANSITION to... INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - LATER 52 Beca’s at her desk with her headphones on, working on her computer. Jesse’s right there, watching her work.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (yelling) I find songs with the same chord progressions and create a track that blends them all together. This is the new baseline, this matches up the downbeats and I’m talking really loud, aren’t I? Jesse nods.

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (kind of shy) And that’s me singing. Jesse takes the headphones and listens to Beca’s “mash-up His eyes light up, clearly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (extra loud) This is really good! (re: volume) Now I’m yelling, right? Beca smiles. Jesse takes off the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’d you know they’d go together? Beca shrugs. Jesse holds up a DVD.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I brought this over ‘cause I want to watch you watch the end of this movie. Then I can die a hero. Jesse inserts a DVD into his computer and turns off the lights. Beca and Jesse are now lit by the screen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You have this habit of making yourself at home, did you know that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse playfully puts a couple of his fingers on Beca’s mo

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ssssshhhhh. (then) “The Breakfast Club.” 1985. Greatest ending to any movie ever. Jesse cues it to the end where Simple Minds’s “Don’t You (Forget About Me)” plays.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This song launched Simple Minds in the U.S. It could have been a Billy Idol song but he turned it down. Dummy. Perfectly sums up the movie - equally beautiful and sad.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Wow. Amazing. What does Judd Nelson like to eat for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Like all misunderstood rebels, he feeds on hypocrisy. And black coffee. Helps with his morning dumps.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You’re an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It’s true. I’m full of fun facts.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You should let other people tell you they’re fun. ON THE SCREEN: We see each character getting picked up, a as the song crescendos, John Bender raises a defiant, joy fist. Jesse, so into it, can’t help but do a smaller vers of it, too. Beca looks at him, more amused by what he’s doing than the movie. He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You're missing the ending. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Inches away from each other’s faces, Jesse makes a move. Freaked out, Beca shuts the laptop. The lights come on. ANGLE ON: Kimmy Jin and several Korea at the door, holding take-out.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMY JIN
dialogues.text: (to Korean friends) The white girl is back. Jesse hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And I’m out. As he leaves...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Always a pleasure, Kimmy Jin! Jesse exits with several “excuse me’s” as he makes his wa past all of the Koreans. In leaving abruptly, he forgot h DVD. Beca reacts, shaking “what just happened” off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dorm room with a skeleton on it, opens, revealing Cynth Rose, dressed as COUNT CHOCULA.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: LYRICS TBD
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: A couple of STUDENTS, staring at her blank-face A door opens, revealing Lilly, dressed in an oversized PILGRIM costume.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: LYRICS TBD
dialogues.text: Her Pilgrim hat-buckle begins to droop over her face. A WREATHED door opens, revealing Stacie, in a barely-ther sexy REINDEER costume, with snow falling around her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: (weird singing)

dialogues.speaker: LYRICS TBD
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STUDENTS, not knowing what to think. A door opens, revealing Fat Amy, bursting out of a too-sm pink CUPID'S costume. Beca, also in costume, awkwardly ho a bow and arrow. REVERSE REVEAL: It’s for Benji and Jesse

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY/BECA
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellas rehearse “Turn The Beat Around.” Chloe solos.

dialogues.speaker: TURN IT AROUND
dialogues.text: Chloe misses a high note. Aubrey winces as they hit their final pose. The ladies look exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (out-of-breath) I should have taken that cardio tip more seriously.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: How much have you done?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: You just saw it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Ladies, that was better but we have a long ways to go before Regionals. Chloe, you have to be able to hit that last note.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I can’t. It’s impossible. Because of... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My nodes. Your nodes.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Well if you can’t, then someone else needs to step up and solo.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I think Beca should sing it.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You too, what?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Beca should take my solo.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Beca could nail that shit! All but Aubrey agree with, “Yeah!” and “Do it,

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: She'd never want to.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Oh, I’1l1 solo. On one condition. We pick a new song and I get to do the arrangement. Bec!” A direct challenge to Aubrey. The girls shift, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: That’s not how we do things here.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aubrey, maybe Beca’s right. Maybe we should try something new.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Aca-what?! (to Beca) You will be singing “Turn the Beat Around” and that’s the last I want to hear of this.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: That song’s tired. We won’t win with that song. Look, if we pulled samples from different genres -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Let me explain this to you because you still don’t seem to understand. Our goal is to get back to the finals. These songs will get us there. So excuse me if I don’t take advice from some alt girl with her Mad Lib beats when she’s never even been in a competition. Have I made myself clear?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (a beat) Crystal. I guess I won’t solo.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Fine. Fat Amy?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (perks up) Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You'll solo. Fat Amy fist pumps, “Yes!” then pulls an “air didgeridoo” from behind her back and plays it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Beca are stacking cd’s. Luke’s in the booth. We see a PHYSICAL CAT & MOUSE GAME: THE STACKING OF CD’S. JE TRYING TO MAKE BECA LAUGH. Luke shakes his head, “What dummy’s.” After a while -

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (to Beca) This is getting exhausting. Luke enters from the booth.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jesse, I’m starving so...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You want me to get you lunch. You should lay off the burgers though. (re: Luke’s tight abs) You won't be twenty-two forever. Luke lifts his shirt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I think I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: ("on board”) He’s good. He’s real good. Jesse looks Luke in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And the chess match continues. Jesse reluctantly goes. Beca grabs a memory stick off the desk and hands it to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Here. This is my latest mix. Maybe you’1l play this one?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, thanks. I/’11 put it with the others.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 56
dialogues.text: INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - DAY 58 Beca, already dressed, stands in front of her mirror. Wit less make-up on and the jacket covering her tattoos, she looks like a “Bella.” She removes the spike from her ear. beat. WIDEN TO REVEAL: Kimmy Jin and a room full of Korea watching a movie with 3-D glasses on. EXT. ZIPPY’S BURRITOS - DAY 59 Bumper, Donald, and UNI, wearing show jackets, exit with ass burritos and pile into Donald's car.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: I could eat these everyday.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD /UNI
dialogues.text: You do. Jinx, bitch! Double jinx! Buy me a coke! Holy crap! Call Guinness! Shit! Oh my God!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald's car pulls up. Guys load onto the Trebles “tricke out” bus. Some Trebles, including Jesse, are already insi when Benji jumps on board.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Can I hitch a ride? I'd take my car, but... I don’t have one. The Trebles just stare at Benji. After a beat, Jesse gets and gently escorts Benji off the bus.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Benji, I’m sorry. I think only Trebles can ride the bus. It’s pretty much a rule.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Of course. Good luck tonight. Benji walks away. Jesse shakes his head, “Poor guy.”  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat Amy fills up the Bella’s van, while Lilly, Cynthia Ro and Beca keep warm inside.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Don’t you flat butts worry. I got this. My thighs are like Gore-Tex. We INTERCUT with The Treble’s bus cruising toward the gas station. Bumper sees Fat Amy at the pump.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Slow down, Donald. Bumper lowers his window and sticks his body halfway out. holds a wrapped burrito in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: (inside the van) Hey, isn’t that?--

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Sabotage! It PEGS her, hard. Fat Bumper WHIPS the burrito at Fat Amy. She Amy FALLS up against the van and SLIDES down its side. GRABS at her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I've been shot! I think I’ve been shot! The ladies JUMP out of the van to tend to Fat Amy. The gu react, “Aw, shit!” Beca turns to find Cynthia Rose trying give Fat Amy mouth to mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sitting up! I’m talking! You don’t need to do that! Fat Amy looks down at the mess, smells it, then takes a b

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bumper threw a big ass burrito at me! Ugh! I will kill him! I/’11 pick my teeth with his bones!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Get up. We have to clean your shirt and we don’t have much time. Lilly puts the gas pump back. They barely put in six buck (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Tell no one what you’ve seen today. (takes another bite) Damn. These are delicious. Scene 61 has been shot and completed. Editorially it 61 has been changed to now reflect 59C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUYS APPLAUD BUMPER’S TAKE-DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Oh! She went down like a Tri-Delt!

dialogues.speaker: KOLIO
dialogues.text: (to Unicycle) So Tri-Delts go down?

dialogues.speaker: UNICYCLE
dialogues.text: Oh, I have no idea. They never talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bellas’s van drives down the highway, now with all th ladies packed tightly inside. Fat Amy drives. Aubrey sits shotgun, nervously playing with the pitch pipe. Beca, sitting directly behind Fat Amy, notices a little guacamo stuck in Fat Amy’s ear. Beca leans forward and wipes it o

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You got yourself a little somethin’ somethin’ in there.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Back off. It fuels my hate fire. Beca laughs, goes to put her headphones on, but stops sho to enjoy the ride. From the back of the van, Chloe, on earbuds, sings Miley Cyrus's, “Party In The USA.”

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: «++. I HOPPED OFF THE PLANE AT LAX

dialogues.speaker: WITH A DREAM AND MY CARDIGAN
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Instinctively, Cynthia Rose joins her.

dialogues.speaker: SO CRAZY/EVERYBODY SEEMS SO FAMOUS
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Beca, “This is lame.” ALL EXCEPT BECA (CONT’D) MY TUMMY’S TURNIN’ AND I'M FEELIN’

dialogues.speaker: KINDA HOME SICK/TOO MUCH PRESSURE
dialogues.text: AND I’M NERVOUS/THAT’S WHEN THE

dialogues.speaker: TAXI MAN TURNED ON THE RADIO
dialogues.text: The girls sing to Beca, nudging her to join. ALL EXCEPT BECA (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: AND THE JAY-Z SONG WAS ON
dialogues.text: Beca can’t help but join in at the cheesy song. It’s just one of those moments. All the girls sing together, momentarily forgetting their problems.

dialogues.speaker: BECA PLUS ALL
dialogues.text: SO I PUT MY HANDS UP/THEY’RE

dialogues.speaker: PLAYING MY SONG/AND THE BUTTERFLYS
dialogues.text: FLY AWAY/NODDIN’ MY HEAD LIKE, YEAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MY HANDS UP/THEY’RE PLAYING MY SONG I KNOW I’M GONNA BE OKAY/ YEAH, IT’S A PARTY IN THE USA! YEAH, IT’S A PARTY IN THE USA! Suddenly, the van starts to putter.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: What the hell? Fat Amy looks down at the fuel gauge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Whoa. We’re almost out of gas?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: That can’t be right. You just filled the tank.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Then the fuel indication meter must definitely be broken. (cackling nervously) It’s suggesting I didn’t fill up the tank because of Mexican food! The van comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And... we’re out.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You can’t be serious!

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (more cackling) Haaaaa, hee, oh woops! What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You guys. We could call -

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Don’t even say it, Chloe! How dare you!?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is silent. The Trebles sit on one side of the bu the Bellas on the other. Lilly sits behind Donald, leanin in to him.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I set fires to feel joy.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: (smiles, no idea) That’s terrific.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Thanks for stopping, Donald.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: All good, boo. I’m The Driver. Jesse motions to Beca to come sit next to him by patting seat. She shakes her head, no, and motions to her girls. ANGLE ON: Bumper in the back of the bus. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: So Bellas, glad we could chauffeur you to your latest Treble-whipping. What boring, estrogen-filled set have you prepared for us today?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Hey. You’re nothing but Manwich in a jacket. And I’m always hungry. So shut. Your. Mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: You're a true woman of class and grace. Gentleman, I believe we were in the middle of our warm-up. Bumper stands, blows the pitch pipe, and sings to Fat Amy

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in scales) YOU CAN SUCK MY BALLS. [ALTS: Eat My Nuts] A beat. Fat Amy sings back to Bumper in scales.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: YOU CAN LICK MY ASS. [ALT: Lick my can/Spread my vegemite] All on the bus stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Bumper and The Trebles jump back into singing their “Ball warm-up, alternating with the Bellas singing “Ass.” They to out warm-up each other as the bus pulls into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus screeches into the parking lot, skidding to a hal

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: The 2012 Southeastern Regional competition is officially underway.  70A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face-painted BARDEN FANS hold signs. Benji’s already ther hoisting a big foam musical note. The entry doors open an the Trebles and Bellas run in, late, and stand in the bac (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON STAGE: The SOCKAPELLAS perform Lilly Allen with sock puppets. At a table, Gail and John talk to camera.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The Sockapellas, proving that it doesn’t “get better” for everyone after high school. The Bellas wait in the back of the theatre, watching the Sockapellas.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: A cappella out of a sock puppet. Genius.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Look at the white one with the black sock.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: It’s making a statement.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: They're complete idiots. There’s no craft there. Watching them will make you worse.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: At least they’re different.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Hands in... The Bellas sloppily puts their hands in.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember. “AHHH” on three. One, two...

dialogues.speaker: MOST LADIES/FAT AMY/STACIE
dialogues.text: AHHH!/A1ll of us?/On three.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: (after three)

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: Aubrey reacts, “I give up.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE
dialogues.text: Let's give it up for the Barden Bellas! The Bellas runs onstage. John and Gail react, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Wow. This does not look like the fresh-faced and nubile Bellas we know.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: You're walking the line, John. What a nice surprise to see them mixing things up. It’s refreshing yet aesthetically displeasing to the eye. Aubrey, at the mic, blows the pitch pipe and counts off. Bellas begins “The Sign” with Chloe stepping forward

dialogues.speaker: LIFE, YOU WOULD HARDLY RECOGNIZE
dialogues.text: ME, I’M SO GLAD... (song continues)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Well this recruiting free-for-all has got to be a direct result of “Vomitgate” from last year.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: IT’S ENOUGH, ENOUGH.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW THAT I... Aubrey takes over the mic, and the solo.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C)
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Senior Aubrey Posen. Her voice is in rare form but she could blow at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE PALE MOON WHERE I SEE A
dialogues.text: LOT OF STARS/IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW/I

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: She held on to her lunch, folks. But there’s a lot of song left... QUICK TO: Back of theatre. Jesse pulls back the curtain a watches Beca. Bumper taps him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Never seen a train wreck before? Aubrey stays at the mic, and the ladies TRANSITION to The Bangles, “Eternal Flame.” They sound very pretty, but there’s still no “wow” factor.

dialogues.speaker: IS IT BURNING, AN ETERNAL FLAME...
dialogues.text: BACKSTAGE with Donald and Uni...

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Aubrey sounds pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: UNICYCLE
dialogues.text: I guess. I’m not really into hot chicks with talent. The Bellas TRANSITIONS to their final song. The now famil “Turn The Beat Around” kicks in. Fat Amy takes the solo.

dialogues.speaker: LOVE TO HEAR THE PERCUSSION...
dialogues.text: Fat Amy sings strongly, while the rest of the girls back up. The girls dancing is a little cheesy but they sell it

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: If I close my eyes and imagine them as what they used to look like, I'd say they’re doing an okay job. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The performance seems like its peaked, until Fat Amy sudd lets loose, dancing her ass off, playing with the crowd. song ends and everyone loves it. As Bellas hits their fin pose, even Aubrey can’t help a little smile. The Bellas runs off stage. Back to Gail and John.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: The Barden Bellas went deep into the archive for that song. I remember singing it with my own a capella group twenty -- ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And what was the group you performed with, Gail?

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: The Minstrel Cycles, John.

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentleman. Barden U’s Treblemakers. The lights go all the way down. IN BLACK: The Trebles sta their arrangement to Flo Rida’s, “Right Round.”

dialogues.speaker: YOU SPIN MY HEAD RIGHT ROUND...
dialogues.text: The choreography is ridiculously silly. Beca looks on, amused at Jesse's performance. Aubrey clocks this, again.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The bad boys of a cappella just got a little badder.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: They sure did, John. I might have to excuse myself to freshen up the downtown. Benji, in the audience, is enthralled. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: (eyes wet) Happy tears!!

dialogues.speaker: B68
dialogues.text: 68 69 Patrons filter out of the theatre while the Tone’s sing T Pain’s “Bootywork.”

dialogues.speaker: CHEEK, RIGHT CHEEK.
dialogues.text: The Trebles bursting onto the scene. Bumper is holding th lst place trophy over his head. The Bellas are not far behind. The Trebles are loud and celebratory and ultimate interrupt the Tones’ performance.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: When are you clowns going to quit pretending you’re in college and get a life?

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Yeah! That’s what we call a... (cupping mouth, mocking) Sonic. Boom. FAISON faces off with Donald.

dialogues.speaker: FAISON
dialogues.text: Hey, just because we’ve graduated doesn’t mean we can’t still get off performing our oral magic.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: (pointing) And don’t think we don’t know what you did to our van! ANGLE ON: Just outside the lobby, the Tone van is parked the street. It’s been turned into the Scooby-Doo “Mystery Machine.”

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: A lot of “don’t” in that sentence. (then to Jason) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sounds like your wife on your birthday.

dialogues.speaker: JASON JONES
dialogues.text: Are you looking for what I think you're looking for?

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: Fight! Fight! Bumper hands the trophy over to Jesse. The Bellas and mem of other groups gather to watch this unfold.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Io... (realizing Jason's size) .«.. would but I pulled a quad during our performance ... but if I did fight you, I would ... Bumper goes to “punch” Jason but stops just short of actu hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OH! That was a kill shot!

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I would beat the talent out of you but I respect the ICCA's too much to taint the floor with your blood... But if I did I would - Jason does the same “near-miss” swing at Bumper’s head.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ARRR! Right to the E.R. For reconstructive head surgery! ANGLE ON: JOE, taunting Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: Hey, you, hit me! Hit me!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to hit you, dude.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: C’mon, nancy boy! Hit me! I want to feel something! DONALD FAISON steps to Donald and pokes him in the should (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAISON
dialogues.text: We doing this? Huh? This is for America. For 9-11!

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Are you for real? I’m Indian. Donald pokes him back.

dialogues.speaker: FAISON
dialogues.text: Well, I hate curry! And your glasses! ANGLE ON: HAR MAR steps up to Stacie.

dialogues.speaker: HAR MAR
dialogues.text: How’s it going, foxy moxy? Wanna see something sexy? He lifts up his shirt and rubs his belly.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: I like your confidence but don’t like your face or body. I’m not sure how to play this. ANGLE ON: Fat Amy watching it all go down. She is desperately trying not to jump in on the action.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: (to Aubrey and Chloe) If I get in there, there’s going to be dork parts caught in the storm drains of these streets for months. Chloe puts her hand on Fat Amy, “You’re not going anywher ANGLE ON: The two Donalds. Not wanting to actually fight, they just grapple with each other, moving back and forth. looks like intense dancing.

dialogues.speaker: FAISON
dialogues.text: Seriously, I can’t hit you if you don’t take off your glasses!

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: I’m not just making a style- statement, these are prescription!

dialogues.speaker: FAISON
dialogues.text: Well, then you better keep them on so you can see me punch you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAISON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Except I can’t punch you if you keep them on!

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Classic Catch-22! They continue. Jason takes Bumper down in a head lock. Jo gets in Jesse’s face. UNI rides around in circles. Gail interviews socks. It’s chaos. ANGLE ON: The Bellas, watching. Some in horror. Some confused.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aubrey, should we try to stop them?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: They are our ride.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: No. The enemy of my enemy is my friend.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t think anyone’s actually fighting? Fat Amy makes her way to JOE. JOE, really starting to lose it, taunts Jesse, Uni, Kolio and any of the other Trebles to go after him.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: Hit me anywhere! I don’t care! (re: his chest) Right in the bread basket! Make it worth it! Back with Bumper and JASON, now wrestling on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You remind me of me when I was your age!

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: I am nothing like you... am I? Back with HAR MAR and Stacie:

dialogues.speaker: HAR MAR
dialogues.text: You can’t resist this. Right now, the “danger” is sending blood straight to your woo-woo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Har Mar puts Stacie’s hand on his belly. Stacie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: You're so confusing to me. Are we both getting lucky, little man? HAR MAR just sticks his tongue out suggestively. After a beat, Stacie makes tongue swirls as well. ANGLE ON: JOE ripping open his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: I’ve been unemployed since the Bush Administration, and am living out of that van. I deserve it! I’m spiritually numb. Give it to me! To settle him down, Jesse finally half-punches Joe.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ok, there you go, guy. JOE, loving it, grabs the Treble trophy and whips it arou like an obsessed man.

dialogues.speaker: JOE LO TRUGLIO
dialogues.text: Yes! Now hit me with the trophy! Use the sharp part! Jesse stands there, speechless. Fat Amy, unable to help herself, CHARGES at JOE and grabs the trophy. Beca goes a her.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: The Kracken has been unleashed!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Oh boy. She goes to hit JOE with the trophy. Beca lunges for her, grabbing part of the trophy.

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Noooo! Stop! Let go! Beca and Fat Amy push and pull on the trophy. Finally Fat lets go. By doing so, Beca can’t help but jerk the trophy back. A piece of it flies off, smashing the lobby window! Everyone looks on, stunned. A police officer happens to be ticketing the Tone van rig outside. When the window smashes, he looks up, right at B (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beca is standing there red-handed. Everyone else comicall darts in every direction.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A proud Beca walks down the steps of the Police Station. Jesse is there, waiting with arms wide open.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hey Hillary Swank in Million Dollar Baby.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You just have to say “Million Dollar Baby.” You don’t have to reference the actress.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I wanted to make sure you got it.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Thanks for bailing me out.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I didn’t. Jesse stops, gesturing down the way. ANGLE ON: DR. MITCHE standing outside of his car. Beca does a 180.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You called my dad?! Why?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: They put you in handcuffs, Bec. It looked pretty serious --

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: That doesn’t mean you call my Dad! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What, do you have another parent I don’t know about? (then, confused) Why are you yelling at me? I’m the only one here.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask you to be. Jesse reacts, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I was trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I don’t want your help. You’re not my boyfriend! Beca starts walking toward Dr. Mitchell. Jesse

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you've made that very clear.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Mitchell) Dad, it’s not a big deal --

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: It is a big deal. I get a call in the middle of the night telling me my only daughter got arrested for destruction of property!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: It was a misunderstanding. I was protecting my friends! Putting myself out there! “Making memories”!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: If you think I’m paying for you to live in LA after you pull a stunt like this? Well, I’m not. Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Wait, don’t you want to listen to what I have to say?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Not tonight I don’t. 80. 70 follows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beca shoots Jesse daggers. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) Jesse gets shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 71
dialogues.text: INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - NIGHT 72 The Bellas and Kimmy Jin are already there when a defeate Beca enters.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Did they spray you with a hose?

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Find yourself a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I did a turn at county.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (touched) You waited up for me?

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Of course we waited up for you. ANGLE ON: Beca, clearly moved by this gesture.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMY JIN
dialogues.text: (getting up) They’ve been here for hours. It’s a real inconvenience, Beca. Kimmy Jin exits. Aubrey blows the pitch pipe.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I’m calling an emergency Bella- meeting. Beca rolls her eyes as the girls gather.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First up? Our score sheet revealed that The Sockappellas almost beat us. We need to bust our asses if we're going to make it to the Finals. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Or try a new approach...

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Enough with that, Beca.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Wait, listen, the reason why we almost lost to sock puppets is because they took a risk. Being good isn’t enough to win.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Beca’s right. The Trebles never sing the same song twice.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: The audience loves the Trebles. They tolerate us. Aubrey, we could seriously change the face of a cappella if you would just let me teach you my music! (hearing herself) That sounded so queerballs. Subtle nods can be seen amongst the girls as Beca moves t her workstation and turns on her computer, keyboard, etc.

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I’ve been working on this arrangement... She starts playing the keyboard, and multi-tasking with h equipment. The music plays and the song gets more and mor layered.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were into all this. The rest react, intriqued. Finally, Aubrey SNAPS BECA’S COMPUTER SCREEN SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You've caused enough distractions for one night. JI have the pitch pipe, and I say we focus on the set list. (to group, forceful) From now on, we eat, sleep, and pee rehearsal. No more wasting our time with work, school, boyfriends ... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looks to Cynthia Rose) Sorry, Cynthia Rose. Partners. Cynthia Rose reacts, confused.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last year we were the first all- female group to get to the finals. I promise you that I’1l get us back there again.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe Beca -- Aubrey holds up the ‘Zip it’ gesture. Chloe cowers.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Let’s get started. Aubrey marches out the door. The rest of the ladies follo her out. Beca just stands there, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is in the booth. Jesse is busy, working on the secon level. Over the PA, we can hear Beca’s music. Beca, dressed in her performance attire, RUNS in, super-psyched

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Holy Crap, it’s my song! Luke, unable to hear her, steps out of the booth. BECA (CONT’D) You're finally playing it!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (pointing up, re: music) Tight Beats.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I’ve always thought her beats were tight. Beca and Luke loop up to Jesse on the second level. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: This is a killer vocal track. The deejay at “The Garage” does a brilliant mix of this song as well but yours is better. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (cocky) Yeah it is.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m going to hear her play tonight. You should come with and check her out.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Ugh, I can’t. I have this thing. Luke takes in Beca’s outfit.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Flight attendant training?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (smiles, sarcastic) Yeah, it’s a three-year program. I learn how to distribute pretzels and wave goodbye. (then) No, I’m a Barden Bella. Tonight’s the semi-finals.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Really? I would have never pinned you as one of those a cappella girls.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: That’s ‘cause you don’t know Becky like I do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse gets up and walks past Beca.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Beca) See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE: The Co-ed group, THE FOOTNOTES, are on stage, i vests. A pint-sized freshman prodigy, TIMOTHY, has the mi and rocks out to The Jackson 5’s, “Blame It On The Boogie

dialogues.speaker: BLAME IT ON THE BOOGIE...
dialogues.text: The Bellas watch from the wings next to Benji, who wears P.A.’s headset and a Barden Performing Arts Center jacket

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Five minutes, Bellas. The ladies are captivated by Timothy’s performance.

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Where did he come from?

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: It's over. The season’s over. We can’t beat The Footnotes and The Trebles.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Wonder where they get their vests made? Aubrey turns to Beca, who looks like she’s hatching a pla She rallies the troops.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Aca-huddle! Now! The top TWO teams go to the finals. We just have to beat one of them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we do it exactly as we rehearsed, we'll get there. (to Beca) Exactly. As The Footnotes finish performing, TIMOTHY BOWS SEVERAL TIMES. BACKSTAGE: The ladies circle up to do “Hands in.” It’s still a struggle.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: That little peanut can sing!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: He sure can. Sounds like his boys haven't dropped, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: If you mean his testicles, then yes. Yes I do, John. We all do. The Barden Bellas are up next. As the Bellas takes the stage, ANGLE ON: Beca, looking ou into the audience. The ladies begin “The Sign.”

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And in true Bella style the ladies are sticking with what they know.

dialogues.speaker: AND IT OPENED UP MY EYES...
dialogues.text: Beca’s eyes bounce from the low-energy audience, to the judges, to the audience. Finally, she makes a decision. From the back of the line and much to the Bellas’s surpri Beca pipes in with La Roux’s, “Bulletproof.” It matches perfectly. Aubrey shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN/GAIL
dialogues.text: Whoa. /Boom!

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: This. Is. Different. Beca’s “mash-up” revitalizes the audience. The judges lea forward. ANGLE ON: Luke, impressed. It’s awesome, until flustered, Aubrey flubs up a little choreography. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You know, it’s so important at these competitions to remember that it’s just a friendly collegiate contest and we’re all just out here to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: GAIL
dialogues.text: So true, John. But a misstep here can haunt you for the rest of your life and affect your children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trebles sit around, goofing off, as the next group ca heard on stage. A beat. An obviously upset Aubrey flings the backstage door open. The rest of the Bellas amble in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: What the hell, Beca, were you trying to screw us up?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Are you serious? The Trebles, including Jesse, stop to listen.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: This isn’t the Beca show!

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Hey, in case you hadn’t noticed everyone pretty much dozed off during our set!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: It’s not up to you to decide what we do and when we do it. Why don’t you ask the rest of the group how they felt about your little improvisation? The gang shuffles awkwardly for a beat, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Fat Amy? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I mean, it was cool and all, but... I guess it sorta took us a little by surprise. The other girls mumble reluctant agreement.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: A lot by surprise. (to Chloe) I told you she wasn’t a Bella.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aubrey, don’t --

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Chloe. I mean... (sarcastic) You don’t actually think you have a say in the group, do you?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Your attitude sucks, you’re a Grade- A pain in the ass, and I know you're hooking up with Jesse! Hearing his name, Jesse crosses over and chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Aubrey, calm down. She’s not. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: God, Jesse! You are always trying to help me! I don’t need helping! Just get out of my face! Jesse throws his hands up in the air, “I’m done.” Benji enters from backstage.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Trebles? Time to bring the pain. The Trebles head for the door, save for Bumper. Beca look at Aubrey and the ladies. There’s a sense that it’s them versus her.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (breaking down) Man, this is what I get for trying! You know what? I’m done. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Beca tears off her scarf and goes. ANGLE ON: Bumper, who starts a slow movie-clap.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Now that was a performance.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, I will eat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upset Beca blows past Benji.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Beca? Benji starts to follow but stops when he notices TIMOTHY being picked up by his mom. Benji clocks the mom’s tote b that reads: MY CHILD IS AN HONOR STUDENT AT JFK HIGH SCHO INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - LATER 77 Beca, still dressed as a Bella, enters to find a bunch of Koreans playing Wii on Kimmy’s bed. She catches sight of herself in her closet mirror, and ma a decision. She takes out her phone and sends a text, CLO her closet door. The closet door OPENS to REVEAL Beca, now dressed to the nines. Behind her, even more Koreans play animated Wii in middle of her room. Beca ducks around them and out the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is there waiting with a BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Everything okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (a little emotional) I’m so done with those girls. Luke nods, then turns to the bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: She’s with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Beca stand close to each other, holding beers.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (Over the music) I can’t believe how much time I wasted on that silly a cappella shit!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s good you’re done with that.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (re: DJ booth) Yeah, I'd rather be up there anyway. This music is dope!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, right? You have good taste.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (blushing) Thanks. Luke picks up on Beca’s energy and realizes he needs to s something He leads Beca across the floor and waves up to Cd who flirts back.

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know her?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, she’s my girlfriend. I’m sure I mentioned her before.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 78A
dialogues.text: They take seats in the lounge, off the dance floor. Beca’ deflated. Luke takes this in. Then: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hey, spring break, at the station, take the night shift. Play your own stuff. Whatever you want. The place is all yours, Becky.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Thanks. You know my name’s actually Beca.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: My name. It’s Beca. Not Becky.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That's weird. Why didn’t you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I really don’t know. An awkward beat between them. BECA (CONT’D) Hey, why’d you finally decide to play my music?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I listened to it, and I thought it was solid. (a beat) Plus, Jesse wouldn’t stop bothering me about it. That kid is relentless. Beca takes this in, “Jesse.”

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the booth) Alright, I’m gonna go hang. You can take care of yourself for a bit, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, sure. I’m good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke heads for the booth where he kisses DJ CJ. PUSH IN o Beca, once again all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aubrey, stone-faced, eyes the “Finals Rehearsal Plan” tha hangs on the wall. A beat. Then, she rips it down, hits t lights and exits, slamming the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: D80
dialogues.text: 80 81 84 85 90. INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM: B80 Kimmy Jin exits with beach gear. Beca watches out her win as cars pull away for Spring Break. Kimmy Jin gets in one with a bunch of friends and drives off, leaving Beca by herself. EXT. BARDEN UNIVERSITY - VARIOUS - SPRING BREAK c80 Empty shots of campus. The school is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beca arrives to an empty station.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO STATION BOOTH
dialogues.text: Beca enters the booth and sits at the console.

dialogues.speaker: A CAPPELLA HEADQUARTERS
dialogues.text: Benji, envelope in hand, knocks on a door marked “I.C.C.A International Championship of Collegiate A Capella.”

dialogues.speaker: JESSE'S CHILDHOOD HOME
dialogues.text: Jesse enters to his parent’s embrace, Regionals trophy in hand. Jesse looks clearly depressed. They won’t let go.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO STATION BOOTH
dialogues.text: Beca’s alone at the console, surprisingly unsatisfied. Sh thumbs through a binder full of CD’s and lands on the soundtrack to “The Breakfast Club.” CLOSE ON Beca, the wheels turning.  86 87 88 89 90 gl. BECA’S DORM ROOM - NIGHT 86 Beca, fighting back tears, wears her headphones. ANGLE ON Her computer. It’s the ending to “The Breakfast Club.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timothy, from The Footnotes, enters. His jaw drops. From TIMOTHY'S POV: Gail, looking authoritative, sits next to Timothy’s mother. CLOSE ON: Timothy. Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aubrey works out and reads, “The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People.” Her cell rings. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: This is Aubrey Posen. Aubrey gets the good news and remains poised.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I look forward to seeing you again at Lincoln Center. She hangs up and then jumps up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a cell phone buzzing. A hand picks it up. We see Chloe lying in a hospital bed, reading a text. She cries like she’s at a funeral. The heart monitor she’s connected to beeps faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a vibrating cell phone in the arm of an inflatable poo raft. A hand picks it up. WIDE TO REVEAL: Fat Amy, lying on the raft, totally chilled, surrounded by HOT GUYS and GIRLS in a clearly exotic locale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a cell phone being pulled out of a pair of tight jeans REVEAL: Lilly, in a parking garage, watching a “Rap Battl She puts her finger to her ear to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a vibrating cell phone resting on a poker table. REVEA Cynthia Rose playing poker in an underground poker game. reads the text, then moves a large pile of chips.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: I’m all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a text coming through on Beca’s cell phone. We see Bec with her headphones on, surrounded by all the movies Jess has mentioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies slap high fives and give congratulations. Fat picks everyone up, squeezing each girl a little too hard.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: The aca-gods have looked down on us and given us a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Shalom!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Let’s get working. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: (chest out) I texted Beca.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: You did what?!

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: She makes us better.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: That’s not an opinion for you to have, Chloe.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Why? Because it’s different than yours? You’re not always right, you know. The ladies react, sensing the tension.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: We win without her. Aubrey blows the pitch pipe and we CUT TO: EXT. JESSE AND BENJI’S DORM - HALLWAY - SAME Beca knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Jesse, I know you’re in there. I can smell the popcorn. EXT. JESSE AND BENJI’S DORM - SAME TIME 93. 95

dialogues.speaker: AQ7
dialogues.text: Jesse, alone, lays on his bed, watching a movie.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Jesse, c’mon. Open the door. He begrudgingly gets up and opens the door. BECA (CONT’D) I've been trying to call you. I left you a bunch of messages. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (trying to stay strong) Yeah. I got em’. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry we fought. I was mad and I overreacted. It’s just, Aubrey drives me --

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: -- Seriously? You think I’m mad you yelled at me?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I know --

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No you don’t know. You think you know, but you don’t. You push away anyone who could possibly care about you. Why is that? Beca reacts, hurt, but takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: (shrugs, quietly) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Well, you better go figure it out, because I’m done with (gestures to the two of them) Whatever this is.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Jesse --

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Done! Jesse closes the door on Beca, leaving her in the hall. J then, Benji comes out of a box full of swords. Jesse grab his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Word.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah.  97 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trebles are there, hanging out in the hot tub. It’s a tight fit and not gay in any way.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Who do you think would make a better dad? Captain America or a great white shark? Bumper enters.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Trebles, listen up.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: If this is about the Bellas getting into the finals, we already know.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: I don’t give a crap about those bitches. I’m being brought up to the musical big leagues. Jesse enters.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just got asked to sing back-up on the new John Mayer album. I leave tomorrow for Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: KOLIO
dialogues.text: But, dude, what about the ICCA’s? They're this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: BUMPER
dialogues.text: Sorry, buddies. I won that shit like a hundred times. I’m out of here. I gotta go buy myself a collarless leather jacket. Bumper strides out. Unicycle gets worked up.

dialogues.speaker: UNICYCLE
dialogues.text: Bumper’s a jerk. There, I said it!

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: Well, we need to replace that jerk. Pronto dente. Jesse gets an idea.  98

dialogues.speaker: A99
dialogues.text: 99 96. INT. JESSE AND BENJI’S DORM ROOM - MOMENTS LATER 98 Benji stands in front of his mirror. He SNAPS his fingers and makes a dove appear from underneath a handkerchief. Jesse enters, all smiles, and holds up a brown hood. It stops Benji in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: A spot opened up, and it’s yours if you want it. Benji’s eyes well up with tears.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just one condition. Promise me you won't get all weird. We're just a group of guys singing covers of songs. If you’re weird, they won't let you stay.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI
dialogues.text: Deal. Although I’m not so sure what you mean by weird. The dove lands on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BENJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies look frustrated and tired. Aubrey is on a tear

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: What is happening to us? Chloe, you sound like you smoke three packs a day. Stacie, you’re behind on the choreography. And Jessica and Ashley, it’s like you haven't even been around all year! Jessica and Ashley, who we’ve barely seen, look at each o and shrug.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Aubrey, give us a break. It’s not the same when we’re not all here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: We need Beca.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Maybe if Aubrey loosened up the reins --

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Shut it, Chloe!

dialogues.speaker: STACIE
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. That was rude. Chloe, could you please get your head out of your ass? It’s not a hat.

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: Awww, dip! EXT. DR. MITCHELL’S HOUSE - NEXT MORNING A100 Beca knocks on a door. It opens, revealing Dr. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: I need you. He smiles. We JUMP CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: No one’s more surprised than me, but I liked those weirdos. Dr. Mitchell gets up to freshen his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: And you thought quitting was the answer? After you made a commitment to them?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re going to talk to me about the sanctity of commitments?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: C'mon, Bec. That's unfair. A beat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dr. Mitche This hits Beca puts Beca nods, 98. 100

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: You left us. Me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: (nods, owning it) I did. Not my finest moment. But I tried to call you. I even learned how to text, but you just shut me out.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I pretty much shut the whole world out. Don’t take it personally. 1l smiles. She’s letting him in. BECA (CONT’D) Sometimes it’s just easier.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: But it’s also really lonely. Beca. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) Look, your mom and I... we didn’t work. So I made a really hard decision. But Beca, leaving you was one of the saddest days of my life. I should have... (shakes head) Well, I’m trying to make up for it now. Which is probably why I’ve been so stingy about you going to LA. So if that’s what you still want, I’1l support you. her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: That’s up to you. This is one of those hard decisions. But, speaking from personal experience, if you’re going to leave something you care about behind, make sure you do it the right way. "Okay." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) You know I’m proud of you, right?

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Proud? Of me?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Yes, proud of you, ya weirdo. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Do we have to hug now?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MITCHELL
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes we do. They hug. Beca, grateful to have her dad uses BOTH ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies are still in the middle of a heated argument. Aubrey rec

dialogues.speaker: FAT AMY
dialogues.text: I joined this group so I could hang with a bunch of broads I thought I could trust. But this is some horseshit. I don’t want to be like those girls on the wall.

dialogues.text: Me too!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Oh, so it’s my fault.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: No, that’s not what I’m saying --

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Well that’s what you’re all thinking, right? I’m the jerk. The girl obsessed with winning! oils and covers her mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: You're too controlling, Aubrey! It’s ruining us!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Hey, I can lose control if I want to! I can let go! This time I’m not going to choke it down! Aubrey puts her hand on her stomach and digs deep.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: We could be champions!! The hurling lasts for a crazy long period of time, most o dry. Aubrey’s body convulses. A beat. Then, Chloe LUNGES for the pitch pipe in Aubrey’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Now you must die! Fat Amy manhandles Aubrey. Lilly JUMPS on Fat Amy’s back mumbles. Cynthia Rose turns to Stacie.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I’11 protect you. She puts her hand directly on Stacie’s breast. Stacie PUL out her Barden rape whistle and blows it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA ROSE (CONT’D) No! False alarm! Nobody likes that! Cynthia Rose tackles Stacie, trying to pull the whistle f her mouth. The rest of the ladies jump in, wrestling with hitting. It’s complete mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: GUYS
dialogues.text: They all FREEZE then turn to find Beca standing at the do

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Nothing. (wiping vomit off herself) This is a Bellas rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: BECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, here goes. I blew it. What I did was a dick move. I should never have changed up our set without asking the group, and I should never have walked out. I let you guys down, and I’m sorry. Aubrey, if you'll have me, I want back in. All eyes on a stone-faced Aubrey. Beca turns to leave, th looks back. Nothing. As she walks, she GRABS a chair and SCRAPES it across the floor. Right before she exits...

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: Wait. Beca turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Thank you. That would have been embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I know I’ve been hard on you, Beca. On everybody. But I’m my father’s daughter. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he always said, “If at first you don’t succeed, pack your bags.” The ladies react, “that’s rough.”

dialogues.text: I get it. Mine gets on me, too.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA ROSE

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Okay, I’ll go. I... was nominated for a Tony when I was twelve. [several alts] The ladies applaud. Aubrey stands, closes her eyes and blurts out --

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY

dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
dialogues.text: I never acted on it because of the oath. But I’ve wanted him ever since we met at Clown Camp.

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Aubrey! You and Uni should be together if that’1l make you happy. And forget that stupid oath.

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY

dialogues.speaker: CHLOE
dialogues.text: Aubrey. Let it go. Aubrey nods, sits next to Chloe and mouths, “I’m sorry.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BECA
dialogues.text: Fat Amy?

dialogues.speaker: AUBREY
